title: Stop Making Sense: Building Creative Confidence
short_description: This program has been postponed to Fall 2018.
list_description: This program has been postponed to Fall 2018.
description:
This program has been postponed to Fall 2018. We apologize for the inconvience.

Cultivate your creativity in an immersive, hands-on weekend workshop offered by two leading cultural institutions: the Art Institute of Chicago and School of the Art Institute of Chicago.

>The design of the workshop is built upon participation, placing a premium on participants’ willingness to roll up their sleeves, apply their analytical skills to new situations, formulate innovative approaches, and share intellectual capital. Participants will be encouraged to view their collective experience from different industries and professional sectors as the building blocks for new skills and insights as they participate in activities designed to build trust, shift perceptions, and inspire breakthrough ideas.Hone observation skills that promote an efficient, discerning, imaginative approach to problem-solvingRefine communication strategies by practing empathic listeningLearn curatorial approaches for establishing priorities and building compelling narrativesPractice constructive criticism in a supportive environmentApproach critical questions collaboratively, examining multiple strategic perspectivesWho Should Attend: Emerging leaders in private and public sectors seeking to meet like-minded peers and renowned faculty, curators, and educators.

Think creatively. Bend the rules. Stop making sense.

Program fee of $1,650 includes Friday dinner, Saturday lunch and dinner, and Sunday brunch; accommodations are not included.

Learn more

To request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program, please call (312) 443-3680 or send an e-mail to access@artic.edu as far in advance as possible.

Please see the museum’s Accessibility page for more information.
